body_html:
The source used to be http://www.nasm.us/pub/nasm/releasebuilds/2.12.02/nasm-2.12.02.tar.bz2 (not .gz) but it was changed because www.nasm.us did not accept connections on the 19th of January 2017. It would increase reliability if this URL was added as a 3rd source. I can confirm that the sha256sum is still right, i.e. is is the same tar file and the same bzip2 compression parameters were used (presumably the defaults).

What traffic can a mirror site expect that hosts the 0.9 MiB nasm packages from bazel clients? In other words, how many fresh builds are made worldwide per month?

It would increase reliability if this URL was added as a 3rd source. I can confirm that the sha256sum is still right, i.e. is is the same tar file and the same bzip2 compression parameters were used (presumably the defaults).

What traffic can a mirror site expect that hosts the 0.9 MiB nasm packages from bazel clients? In other words, how many fresh builds are made worldwide per month?
